paper_metadata.title: BRCA1 and BRCA2 germline mutation analysis in the Indonesian population
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: Invasive ductal carcinoma, diagnosed at age 34

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient B34 with BRCA2 c.3040_3043del4 was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 34.

functional_data.summary: The deletion leads to a frameshift mutation, likely resulting in a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and mutation type.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is classified as pathogenic due to its predicted effect on protein function.
key_quotes: The c.3040_3043del4 mutation in BRCA2 was found in a patient diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma.

patients.phenotype: Invasive ductal carcinoma, diagnosed at ages 37 and 40

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient W-II37 with BRCA2 c.6775G>T was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 37.
Patient AZ40 with BRCA2 c.6775G>T was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 40.

functional_data.summary: The mutation results in a premature stop codon, leading to a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and mutation type.
variants.additional_notes: Both patients presented with invasive ductal carcinoma, indicating high penetrance.
key_quotes: The p.Glu2183X mutation was found in 2 related patients that had breast cancer above the age of 60.

patients.phenotype: Invasive ductal carcinoma, diagnosed at ages 30 and 40

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient B-III-530 with BRCA2 c.2699_2704delTAAATG was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 30.
Patient AZ40 with BRCA2 c.2699_2704delTAAATG was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 40.

functional_data.summary: The deletion leads to a frameshift mutation, likely resulting in a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and mutation type.
variants.additional_notes: Both patients presented with invasive ductal carcinoma, indicating high penetrance.
key_quotes: The c.2699_2704delTAAATG mutation was found in one other patient in the present study.

patients.phenotype: Invasive ductal carcinoma, diagnosed at age 37

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient W-II37 with BRCA2 c.9008C>T was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 37.

functional_data.summary: The mutation results in a premature stop codon, leading to a truncated protein.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and mutation type.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is classified as pathogenic due to its predicted effect on protein function.
key_quotes: The p.Gln2894X mutation was found in a patient diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma at age 37.

tables_processed.table_caption: BRCA1 or BRCA2 germline mutations in Indonesian women with early onset breast cancer

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
